column4: Hi, I'm having some trouble with very slow DNS responses, it's the same in all browsers. Pining my default dns server works ok with short response times, IPv6 is disabled. What more can I do?
what DNSs are you using?
cat /etc/resolv.conf     will tell you]
Its my isp's default I guess: nameserver 193.150.193.150 nameserver 83.255.245.11
run:  gksudo gedit /etc/resolv.conf    change the servers to 8.8.8.8   and 8.8.4.4
Will that change be permanent?
save the new file, close gedit and try the web. If it's better then you will need to set the DNS in network manager so that the settings stick between reboots
is it better?
Ok
No, no difference. Chromium used to be fast, now it says "Sending request..." for maybe 10-15 sec before opening page
does it happen as all users?
Haven't tried
worth exploring :)
Yep, same on all users
could install dnsmasq to cache dns resolutions ;)
makes the web faster
ok, I can ttry that
I already have dnsmasq-base, do I need dnsmasq also?
http://embraceubuntu.com/2006/08/02/local-dns-cache-for-faster-browsing/
